rationales.hedonism: He rejects promotion to protect enjoyable personal time and quality of life.
rationales.stimulation: He prefers a less constrained life over a predictable executive track.
rationales.power: He declines a higher-status director role despite external pressure.

rationales.stimulation: He describes sameness as suffocating and needing novelty to feel alive.
rationales.hedonism: He frames enjoyment as a core life goal rather than a reward after status gains.

rationales.stimulation: He is energized by high-pressure operational chaos and improvisation.
rationales.hedonism: He intentionally closes the day with music, grilling, and sensory enjoyment.
rationales.achievement: He solves the shipment failure within the day and restores client confidence.

rationales.stimulation: He spontaneously books a new experience instead of sticking to routine.
rationales.hedonism: The mezcal trip is chosen primarily for pleasure and fun.

rationales.conformity: He restrains his complaint and performs expected son-in-law behavior to avoid conflict.
rationales.stimulation: He endures repetitive routine he finds draining instead of seeking novelty.
He chooses surf travel and open-ended experiences over fixed corporate rhythm.
rationales.hedonism: The entry emphasizes joy, food, and leisure as deliberate priorities.
